website_summaries.verdict: This heavy-duty reservoir is modeled after the style used in all US military tactical packs.
pros: Standard fit in all military tactical packs
cons: Bag does not self-seal when you remove the drinking hose, so it can leak during filling

customer_reviews.title: Deployments to Hikes
customer_reviews.text: I used Camelbaks while on multiple deployments so when it came time to purchase reservoirs for my sons in preparation for a 3 day hike along the Appalachian Trail I turned to proven equipment. It was going to be a tough hike and I knew having a reservoir break for any of us would be detrimental so I didn't skimp on it. Everything from the thickness of the rubber to the bite to the positive on/off water shutoff performed just as I knew it would. There are cheaper versions but the military grade versions are designed to take more abuse and still perform.
customer_reviews.author: USAF93

customer_reviews.title: Best water bladder on the market.
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm. 5-10k's in the back woods nearly every day for 2 weeks now and this thing has been a champ. I hike wearing a plate carrier with AR500 front, back and side plates (aprox 25 lbs) with full accessory gear (another 5lb) as well as a backpack that is packed full of survival gear (another 10-15 lbs) which can hold the water bladder as well (5 lbs full?). So when I hop on the scale without the rig on I am 230, with the rig on I am 278-280. Without this thing I would probably be dead from dehydration somewhere in the back woods half eaten by a pack of coyotes.
customer_reviews.author: An Honest CustomerTop Contributor: Hydroponics

customer_reviews.title: Camelbak quality going down?
customer_reviews.text: Mouth piece hose adapter broke during normal use. I kinda expected it to be a bit more durable then the blue bladders, but as far as I can tell, it's basically the same, only black. For the record, I'm not hard on my equipment. As far as I can tell, it broke just from using it. In the past 20 years, I've never had a Camelbak break this way (this is only my third bladder)
customer_reviews.author: J. Hulstein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect bladder for my Camelbak Lobo
customer_reviews.text: Needed to replace a knock-off bladder because the bite valve was terrible and found this deal. 3L is the size I use and the price was right, so I took the leap and I am glad I did. The bite valve is great (no leaking, good flow, easy to open/close while riding), it has an insulated hose (we'll see how well it does during snowboarding season) and it fits perfectly in my trusty, dusty old Lobo. Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Larry Dickman

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement
customer_reviews.text: Read the reviews and was a little hesitant about making the purchase. Some reviewers mentioned that it leaks and does not seal properly while others did not like the removable hose. I took the chance and I am very happy that I did. I've taken this reservoir on trail rides 9 times now and have not experienced any leaks. As long as you thread the cap on properly and make sure it's tight, you shouldn't have any issues with leaks. I also like the new material compared to the older version, it appears to be sturdier. The reservoir hose is insulated and has plenty of length. Definitely happy with my purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DistantLights

customer_reviews.title: Gotta Love Staying Hydrated
customer_reviews.text: Camelback is a trusted name in the hydration game. I have had a few back pack type hydration systems and Camelback is my go to. I needed to replace the bladder in my Mule. The Mule cleaned up really well in my clothes washer. This bladder fit the bill and it even had the toggle shut off which the old one didn’t have. The old one didn’t have the insulated sleeve on the tube like the new one either. Highly recommended 5 star rating.
customer_reviews.author: raj from chicagoTop Contributor: Cycling

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put in my old Camelbak Blowfish hydration pack. The reservoir fits fine but it's a tight fit to thread the hose through the slot at the top of the pack since this model has a valve on the hose to prevent it from potentially leaking. Since the hose can be disconnected from the reservoir, I flipped it around and put the valve near the reservoir so it's easier to to put in my pack because I've never had an issue with the bite portion leaking while I'm riding. Seems very durable and worked great on 4 rides. The first couple rides it had a plastic/chemical taste but the last two it's been fine.
customer_reviews.author: Hemi345

customer_reviews.title: It keeps me from dying
customer_reviews.text: So far this product works great, I haven't died of dehydration. It feels like the Phillipine child that probably made it cared about my safety while I am hiking. The tube is sturdy and easy to drink out of. Carries plenty of water for Arizona hiking. My girlfriend even says it makes me look hotter, but that could be related to her smaller water reservoir and her need to drink from mine on long trips. I have even been complimented on how big it is.
customer_reviews.author: eric gorecki

customer_reviews.title: Great Replacement Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to use with a narrow backpack whose bladder had worn out. Love the pack and must wanted a compatible bladder. This one fit perfectly. I especially appreciate the wide opening for adding liquid and the insulated tube. The straight mouthpiece has an "on/off" switch, but one still must deliberately bite on the mouthpiece to open the slit to drink. The bladder drained easily. 3L is adequate for most (of my) day rides. I put ice in the bladder before filling it with water, so I had cool water all day even in 100 degree temperatures.
customer_reviews.author: Steve B

customer_reviews.title: Works well. Nice neoprenen covered tube.
customer_reviews.text: Works great. I like the soft neoprene on the hose. Water tastes like plastic. This is my first CamelBak, so that may be just how it goes, or maybe I should have washed it with baking soda. Anyways, as far as camelbak's go, this one is top notch. I put water in, and froze it in the freezer and had great, cold water all day long.
customer_reviews.author: Travis Strah

customer_reviews.title: It's a bladder
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my teaching job, I go through one a season (motorcycle course). It works well with my backpack carrier, but the bite valve on this is not designed to stop the water flow, you have to turn on and off the "gate" on the end. I have occasionally felt the side of my torso and leg wet with water because I'm used to bite valves that seal themselves. I guess that's just the nature of this beast. Great for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Gerry Dana

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Replacement!
customer_reviews.text: I appreciate that the replacement is "partable". My old Camelback was press on tubing, this new one is quick connect. I like that the new one is "chambered" dispersing the fluid across the backpack and not having the fluid "ball up" bulging the backpack at a point and making it difficult to keep other items in it. I don't know about cleaning it... yet! Mine is solely used for water and I try to use filtered water at that. In short, I'm a Camelbak fan!!!
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Good enough
customer_reviews.text: The material is thicker and presumably more durable than the blue bladders. However bladder does not hold water when the hose was detached from the bladder. Worthless to have a quick disconnect for easy filling when disconnecting leaves the open valve and water squirts out. You can't take it to the water source, fill it and bring it back. This is not how the blue bladders with disconnect valve work. Stupid. I'll go ahead and live with it, however I would't have bought it had I known this before.
customer_reviews.author: yogatoga

customer_reviews.title: Excellent
customer_reviews.text: It holds plenty of water and it's very easy to fill due to the plastic handle, large mouth and screw on lid. The tube is long enough that I never have to tilt my head down to drink and it fits through the bottom rung on my pack strap, so it stays out of the way while I'm walking. My only concern, and it's a big one, is that it doesn't come with a bite valve cover. Since the tube is so long, I have no idea how much deer, elk or bear crap it might have been drug through on my first hunt with it. I immediately ordered a bite valve when I got home.
customer_reviews.author: mntnbiker

customer_reviews.title: Amazing price and product!
customer_reviews.text: Why is this cheaper that the blue version? Same product BUT...... it comes with so much more items. First, It comes with a shut off switch. At no extra charge! No dripping. This feature works great. Second, it comes with an insulator sleeve that is usually sold as an accessory. Third, it uses the system that allows different bite valves. All this for almost half the price of the blue version. Amazing value.
customer_reviews.author: West

customer_reviews.title: Awesome !!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of hiking in SoCal, hence it is friggin HOT. This is a big bladder. Hold plenty of water. I love the shut off on the valve so i get no drips, the bite valve is easy. The bite valve set up is a little large so i have to disconnect when i put it in or remove it from my REI pack.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Walker

customer_reviews.title: No bite valve cover
customer_reviews.text: I consider this in incomplete product as it doea not ship with a bite valve cover. Most be purchased separately for $9, so factor that into the cost of the overall product. I can't imagine a use case where it's acceptable to have your bite valve rolling about in the dirt, especially if this is for tactical use.
customer_reviews.author: Kukhri

customer_reviews.title: Essential equipment for anyone hiking or doing long walks
customer_reviews.text: Gamechanger for me during my long walks. Living in AZ’s heat makes it a challenge to get enough water/hydration when you are outside. This allows me to be out for 2-3 hours without running out of water. I’m sure I’ll love it for hiking this fall as well.
customer_reviews.author: Suzi

customer_reviews.title: Great start that went downhill fast
customer_reviews.text: This bladder upped my hiking game instantly...for the first 10 hikes. I am truly disappointed to say that it is no longer working and there are visible tears in the mouth piece. I am not happy as I spent more money on what I thought would be a more long-lasting product. I am hoping that Camelbak replies to my warranty request and makes this right as I did love this product for many miles of well-hydrated hiking:(
customer_reviews.author: LCM

customer_reviews.title: Tube leaks after owning less than 1 year
customer_reviews.text: I bought this bladder because I like the insulation around the tube. Unfortunately, after only a few months and uses, the place where the tube connects to the bladder started leaking. Within a few minutes of inserting the reservoir into my pack, my entire back side is drenched. Outside of the return window, so unfortunately have to throw away.
customer_reviews.author: Kaitlyn O.

customer_reviews.title: Camelbak 100 oz water reservior reveiw
customer_reviews.text: While an avid walker, hiker and cyclist, I have over a period of 20 years have found the CamelBak indispensable both in WA & AZ. In AZ I use it on a daily in the car and around the home. I fill is with ice & water and it is just great. And of course while in WA I also use in in the car and on all road trips. And at night it take it to bed so I can easily drink water without having to leave the bed. It has so many uses!!!
customer_reviews.author: George E Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Much better than the original
customer_reviews.text: We have used this on hikes - as a replacement for another bladder that wore out. This is heavier duty, and is very well made. The drinking tube is covered by a neoprene cover, and the bite valve is straight and very well made. It's a great replacement, and much better than the original Camelbak water reservoirs. This carries a good amount of water - a day's worth in normal use, or certainly a few hours on the trail. I'm happy I found this and will buy it again when our others wear out.
customer_reviews.author: ifr

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly. Tastes bad.
customer_reviews.text: Love the mouth piece. Much better than the L version on the civilian ones. First use the water tasted like plastic, even after washing it before use. I am trying the Camelbak tablets to see if that works and baking soda after. Functions perfectly. Only reason for 3 stars is the taste. If taste persists after trouble shooting it will be returned.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff L

customer_reviews.title: Withstands Wildland Firefighting
customer_reviews.text: Durable. Really, really durable. Survives longer than standard CamelBak (which we still love) in Wildland Firefighting: regular/hard use for 6 months or more every year.
customer_reviews.author: GLT

customer_reviews.title: THE BEAST!
customer_reviews.text: If you're having trouble with your current reservoir and if you're like me sitting at home researching which one to get next, then SAY NO MORE! I highly suggest you get this one. It works like a charm. It does not leak and is extremely easy to fill up. Water comes out the tube as if I was drinking water with a straw. It has a switch to close it on and off so water does not spill, and YES a cap is included. It seems much higher quality compared to the regular reservoirs, so give it a try!
customer_reviews.author: Papi

customer_reviews.title: Great buy, neoprene cover is great.
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect replacement for my Omega bladder I had in my old Camel Bak. Having the neoprene cover is a nice addition. It helps to keep the water in the tube cooler while hiking.
customer_reviews.author: SF

customer_reviews.title: Quallity
customer_reviews.text: I've had these before and this one is definitely top notch. I know when you're shopping for these there are plenty of cheaper options, but when it comes to hydration that is something you should never skimp on and these CamelBak's are the best.
customer_reviews.author: Michael W.

customer_reviews.title: got H2O?
customer_reviews.text: Had this for a couple years now and it has help up really well. like that it holds a good bit of water. I use it in an insulated book bag but that is the only room for improvement (insulation). These things are never easy to clean but this one is easy enough. The hardest part is making sure it is dry before storing it - maybe should try using a hair dryer or something. I need to try filling it with beer for an festival!
customer_reviews.author: SNehn042

customer_reviews.title: Way to long
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately this reservoir is way to long. How about Camelbak brings back the normal size - not round, and not 3 feet long.
customer_reviews.author: Roman

customer_reviews.title: so much better than the stock reservoir that came with my mule
customer_reviews.text: Wow, so much better than the stock reservoir that came with my mule...this includes line insulation which works well to prevent that warm line water and a nice shut off valve to prevent leakage, appears to be slightly higher quality plastic but warning it might be trickier to spot mold if you don't take proper care to clean it....Not sure which camelbak model comes with this but going forward i'll just buy a knock off cheap water backpack and put one of these in there....i'm currently using this in a normal small backpack with the outer hanging loop folded inside to keep the water vertical, works great as a commuting hydro backpack...
customer_reviews.author: Longhorn Fan

customer_reviews.title: The tube has a neoprene like cover, so it keeps the tube from freezing ...
customer_reviews.text: I have purchased several of these bladders. They are stronger and more durable than the consumer grade bladders with negligible weight and nominal incremental cost. They also have quick connects at the bladder base and the bite valve so you can disassemble it and actually get the darn thing cleaned. The shutoff valve is also a higher quality than the consumer grade and much easier to operate. The tube has a neoprene like cover, so it keeps the tube from freezing too quickly in the winter, and keeps the drinks cooler in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: denver

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought it on Amazon to use it for a 2-week Isle Royale back-country hiking & camping trip. It has plenty enough volume, 3L, to last a day of hiking. It seals up really well. No leak whatsoever. I especially like the double safety features of the valve. Even though I accidentally press on the bite valve, it won't leak unless the safety valve is also open. You can also disconnect the drinking tube from the bladder. This makes it convenient for cleaning and storage. Overall, I love it. Just one caveat: why don't the manufacturer install the bite valve cover with it?! sincerely yours
customer_reviews.author: Sincerely Yours

customer_reviews.title: Durable and Massive
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to put into various packs for hiking and backpacking for a major road trip. First of all this thing is HUGE. I feel like I can drink endlessly before this thing runs out. The plastic is thick and strong, more so than older camelbaks I've owned. The removable tube connector at the bottom and for the mouthpiece makes cleaning and drying much simpler. Another use I've found for this large reservoir is showering. When it's hot out one can take a perfectly adequate and effective shower by removing the mouthpiece and using the hand valve. A great product that is well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: teh_trout

customer_reviews.title: Great Purchase, Highly Recommend it for All Hiking Levels
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on number of backpacking trips in various backpacks and it's worked great. Nothing on it has ever leaked, and it's fit great in every pack I've purchased. Not even necessary to use an actual camelbak backpack, the bladder can be put in almost any brand hiking backpacks/daypack. If you're thinking about getting this and aren't sure if you really need a bladder, I'd strongly recommend getting it. Being able to drink water without stopping is extremely nice, and the weight distribution is way better than if you were to carry a big Nalgene.
customer_reviews.author: dmr

customer_reviews.title: Works Perfectly
customer_reviews.text: I bought a Camelback knock off and it leaked like sieve and was impossible to draw water through, i.e., useless other than the backpack part of it. Bought the genuine Camelback house and bladder and it works perfectly!
customer_reviews.author: Gerald P.  Williams

customer_reviews.title: Great except leaky mouthpiece
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old three-liter CamelBak. It is well-made and durable. The only downside is that the mouthpiece leaks; after drinking and then closing the valve there is water left between the valve and end of the mouth piece that leaks out of the end of the mouthpiece. My old camel back didn't have a valve, and the mouthpiece didn't leak from the end.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Buy the newer model now, not this one.
customer_reviews.text: This was a fine bladder to own at the time. But now I am lowering my rating from 5 stars to 2 stars because Camelbak has released their Milspec Antidote Short, which is in a class by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Hank

customer_reviews.title: Started Leaking
customer_reviews.text: Mine started leaking from the quick connection at the base of the bladder to the hose. O-ring looks good.
customer_reviews.author: Cameron Craven

customer_reviews.title: Fits well....but.
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in the pack that I already had but the hose is much longer then the old one causing it to to hang out much farther. All in all though it is a great replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Disconnect/connect does not work - one will not disconnect all all. !  Useless
customer_reviews.text: Bought the bladder to be an additional bladder to the 100 oz Mil Spec purchased previously with the intent of swapping the hoses while in the field. Quick connect/disconnect that works wonderfully on the Mil Spec version does not work at all on the black 100 oz bladder. One connector would not disconnect at all. Buy something else !
customer_reviews.author: J. Bock

customer_reviews.title: Huge CamelBak Great for Day Trips!
customer_reviews.text: I love the size of this CamelBak, it's big enough to last a day of intense hiking and is great to travel with water ready to drink anywhere anytime. It is extremely hard to open the reservoir back up for refilling but I guess the tight seal is great for preventing leaks. I use it in all my backpacks and it fits great in all of them. I highly recommend this product and I use it every time I travel and camp!
customer_reviews.author: Klyftonite

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement for my old MULE
customer_reviews.text: This reservoir fits in my old Camelback MULE. The larger opening makes it possible to clean the inside, rather than just rinse. I like the tab that I can hold to place the opening perpendicular to the dispenser. Minor niggles: The connection points are a little chunky; pulling the bite valve through the openings is tight. The insulated tube is so thick that clamp on my shoulder strap can barely hold it; occasionally it pops off. Nonetheless, I still give it 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: IO

customer_reviews.title: Works Very well for intended purpose.
customer_reviews.text: works well i used this on a camping trip this weekend where it got into the 20's or below and it froze of course with no insulation. I would highly recommend this to anyone who understands the limits of a hydro bladder. Has a long tube, 3 liters of capacity and its not much more bulky than the 2 qt one from Walmart i believe its outdoor products. I would also recommend this to anyone looking at the condor hydro harness for your chest rig. separate review of mine posted there.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany G.

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't leak easy to clean
customer_reviews.text: Great product, however like most bladders the rubber taste takes a bit to go away. Otherwise well worth the money spent.
customer_reviews.author: Slockem

customer_reviews.title: Nicer than the ones in the store
customer_reviews.text: So far so good. A little longer than the pack I put it in but it’s not that big of a deal. I like that the hose is wrapped in fabric of some kind, keeps it from possibly being cut. Also the mouth piece is much more comfortable to work with.
customer_reviews.author: Alex C.

customer_reviews.title: Best Winter Water Reservoir
customer_reviews.text: This is perfect for the Winter months when we are snowboarding. This was a replacement for my fiance's Burton backpack, and the insulated tube plus the upgraded mouthpiece make all the difference. The neoprene sleeve on the tubing kept his water from freezing long after mine! I was concerned that it wouldn't fit since it was a different brand, but there were no fit issues. I recommend this for anyone looking for a winter water res!
customer_reviews.author: Kmberly B

customer_reviews.title: nice bladder
customer_reviews.text: love the quality here. i got this for my maxpedition falcon II backpack. turns out the bladder is slightly long for the hydration compartment of the pack, but oh well, it wasnt designed specifically for that. bladder is 18" long hose is 44" connection to connection. falcon II bladder compartment is 16" i think theres a shorter, wider bladder that would fit better. all in all, great. im happy with this product
customer_reviews.author: Rhys

customer_reviews.title: Durable but with a catch
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice heavy duty bladder that can take some abuse. However, where the hose connection to the bag is placed is a terrible position because it has to go down into the heartof your backpack where the bulk of the weight is centered and if you don't position the elbow juuuuusssttt right it gets squished and can leak from the joint. Ive had it dump a liter of water down my back through my gear and into my sleeping bag now on a couple of occasions and was far less than happy about it... Would beva lot better if the elbow was positioned a little differently
customer_reviews.author: BC

customer_reviews.title: Simply awesome
customer_reviews.text: This thing worked great for my recent backpacking trip. It holds plenty of water, has an insulated hose, and a valve for a reassuring water cutoff. I'll be purchasing another for my wife. Stop looking and buy it now.
customer_reviews.author: SciFiFreak

customer_reviews.title: Pretty nice
customer_reviews.text: This was my first hydration purchase, so after some research, I went with Camelbak for their high ratings for quality. Since then, I have found Source Tactical products to be easily equal for quality and better for maintenance. The big difference is the Source takes down quickly to let you put your hand in the reservoir for cleaning without fancy tablets, brushes, or drying racks. Camelbak would still be my second and only choice after Source.
customer_reviews.author: tazmaniac

customer_reviews.title: Easy to replace
customer_reviews.text: Works great and easy to replace for my dirty water reservoir. Will look here again when I need to get a replacement .
customer_reviews.author: Ricky

customer_reviews.title: Swing and a miss
customer_reviews.text: Received with a whole in the seam. Leaked immediately. Sent it back and received a full refund. Without a hole I’m sure it would be great.
customer_reviews.author: books

customer_reviews.title: Very well made
customer_reviews.text: The omega was exactly what I was looking for. It is very tough and I like the hose shut off (stops leaks). It also came with a plug that replaces the hose enabling me to use the bladder as a water carrying devise without the hose being connected. I can carry two bladders; when one becomes empty, simply unhook the hose from one and plug it in to the other. The hose pictured is much shorter than what you get (a good thing). All in all, I'm very happy with my purchase. I would highly recommend this product to a friend.
customer_reviews.author: NR-EMT-P

customer_reviews.title: Replaced the old military style and just shoved this into ...
customer_reviews.text: Replaced the old military style and just shoved this into my old camelbak. No more leaky o-rings. Win / win. I can't fill it without taking it out of the pouch, but don't be lazy.
customer_reviews.author: Oz

customer_reviews.title: Unsecure mouthpiece and bladder leak
customer_reviews.text: Mouthpiece fell off when i was jogging even though hose was secure. Bladder also developed a leak after a couple months. Only used when jogging. Nothing extreme. Poorly made.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Recommended Christmas present
customer_reviews.text: For quality and durability this was recommended to us as a Christmas present.
customer_reviews.author: KWA

customer_reviews.title: Great upgrade
customer_reviews.text: This is much better than the bladder that came with my camelpac. It is so easy to disassemble and clean
customer_reviews.author: K-9-Ja

customer_reviews.title: Gets the job done!
customer_reviews.text: This was my first (and still only) CambelBak, so I don't have anything to compare it to, but it has worked great for me. I've had it for a couple years now and still don't have a problem with it leaking at all, and it fits in both of my packs without issue. The hose is plenty long enough (if anything it might be a little on the long side of things). I've only taken it on one winter hike so far, but it resisted from freezing (there were some small ice chunks forming on the inside of the tube but nothing that blocked it completely).
customer_reviews.author: mjolnir

customer_reviews.title: Nice product so far.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure why the packaging states that it's not meant to be used in a chemical latent environment. I mean, if there was some chemical warfare going on, all the foot would be destroyed, so you'd be screwed either way. I guess it's just a marketing ploy. The product seems solid, and the hose is nice and long, plus it comes with a soft sleeve over the hose.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Product incomplete no bite tube cover
customer_reviews.text: I bought this military grade CamelBak bladder for $30 and it didn't come with a bite tube cover. A $5 part that completes the order. I dislike having to buy individual parts when that should be the standard to have a bit tube cover. Raise your level your customer expectations when they purchase your product.
customer_reviews.author: Robert M.

customer_reviews.title: Nice hydration reservoir,  holds plenty of liquid for hiking trips.
customer_reviews.text: Good quality construction. Has a hook to mount inside a hydration carrier or pack. But most carriers I've seen, come with velcro tabs to hang the bag with, and this had no place to run the velcro tabs through for mounting it any way except the main hook it comes with. If your carrier doesn't have the center hook, you will need some 550 cord to tie around the nozzle to run to the velcro tabs to secure it to your carrier.
customer_reviews.author: STEELRAIN

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I got it to replace a decades old 100 oz reservoir in a Camelbak Mule. The fit was good but it was just a tiny bit taller than the one it replaced. Close enough to work though. I like the 100 oz size because on my long bike rides in the country it's imperative to stay hydrated. It's still fairly new so all the plumbing is tight and no leaks. Filling is easy with large mouth that seals tightly. Bite valve is decent and replaceable. Can't think of any cons.
customer_reviews.author: diane

customer_reviews.title: Does its job
customer_reviews.text: I use this for my backpacking trips and it's very durable. It keeps the water in my backpack chilled which is great during long hikes. The on/off switch on the tube is nice so water does not leak out unintentionally. It doesn't leak either. Unfortunately, the black insulation on my tube draws the heat from the sun in and warms up the portion in the tube so you need to drink the part in the tube in order to get to the refreshing water in the bladder.
customer_reviews.author: Steph S

customer_reviews.title: As expected, high quality
customer_reviews.text: As expected. Fine quality water reservoir. I only had the original that came with my camelbak for many years which started leaking from the nozzle during runs. This is a great replacement and I like the on/off valve for the nozzle. No more leaking. The hose is quite a bit longer than my original blue bladder...but not a problem really.
customer_reviews.author: Freedonia

customer_reviews.title: Best bladder system hands down !
customer_reviews.text: Can’t go wrong with camelbak! I have 3 of them as I use them for the military and work at home.
customer_reviews.author: Weeks

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic purchase
customer_reviews.text: My first backpacking trip I made the mistake of only taking a liter of water thinking there would be a water source near by. I will never have to worry again with this huge 100oz reservoir, it comes with a plug so you can have an extra one in your pack if you really need that much water. Tried and tested brand, I love this thing.
customer_reviews.author: Cassidy Brewster

customer_reviews.title: Great Bladder for Hiking
customer_reviews.text: This bladder served my very well during a recent trip hiking in the Austrian Alps. The bladder is large enough for a full day of hiking and does not have the "chemical" taste that some competitors products do. The seal is quite easy to utilize and works very well. I also I really appreciated the insulated delivery tube. Overall, this bladder is a great addition to any hiking setup.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A top quality product that is easily cleaned. The dogs (and I) particularly the detachable ...
customer_reviews.text: A top quality product that is easily cleaned. The dogs (and I) particularly the detachable mouth piece so that they get a solid stream of water on the trail. The control value is great for preventing wet clothing!
customer_reviews.author: John J. Baich

customer_reviews.title: The ONLY hydration bladder I will buy!!!
customer_reviews.text: Great hydration bladder that does NOT leak. I am glad I went by the reviews and spent a little extra money because it will pay for itself in a short time. I also bought the big bite valve cover and it fits great with this product. I must say that I like the shape of this bladder as it seems to have a more natural fit in my condor 3 day assault pack. Give this a try and it is well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: rizzaman12

customer_reviews.title: camelbak omega
customer_reviews.text: After researching water bladder I figure this was probably the best one for the price range & I was right. I take this thing backpacking and I'll even put it on my pack for fishing. 0 leaks, super strong & the bite valve works great. It has an on off switch and the tube, bladder, bite valve all disconnect for easy cleaning. Couldn't have asked for a better one. Would definitely buy again
customer_reviews.author: Steven B.

customer_reviews.title: Great for hiking!
customer_reviews.text: works. Got stuck at the bottom of the Grand Canyon with a NorthFace hydration system that sprung a leak. Not great timing. Picked this CamelBak up for my next hike and so far it's working as described. Seems sturdy and opening is big enough for ice cubes. The shut-off value means it doesn't drip when I stuff my backpack too full and put pressure on the bag.
customer_reviews.author: jski

customer_reviews.title: Lots of extras
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. Price was great and includes insulation for tubing and quick change adapter for tubing. Fits my Camelbak MULE, old one finally broke after six years. The 3L capacity is great for all day use. You get the reservoir with a free insulated tubing kit that includes a blank end, I assume for NBC mask. This is the way to go since insulated tubing is $20, old reservoir was hard to clean since tubing did not disconnect from reservoir, new one does at the base.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great blatter  but cheap tube
customer_reviews.text: This is a great Water Reservoir. no leaks at all. i use it every day at work. The only bad think is the long tube. It is really cheap. it kinks up really easy. luckily I had a extra tube from my last Water Reservoir.
customer_reviews.author: Erika A. Bathke

customer_reviews.title: Same as the original from 15 years ago
customer_reviews.text: Just like the original one I had which was 15 years old. My old one was beginning to have a foul taste. If this one lasts that long....great.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan S. Teaff

customer_reviews.title: Good replacement. Still tastes like plastic
customer_reviews.text: Good replacement. Still tastes like plastic. You have to fill it right before you leave because even 24 hours makes the water almost undrinkable.
customer_reviews.author: Beergod

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy a knockoff
customer_reviews.text: Never had a leak and have accidentally left for two weeks without any grossness. Great water flow too. I can wear this on my back confident that my stuff and me won’t get wet and my hike can proceed as planned.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Lewis

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: What can I say it works for me...I tried all the other brands even the source one and always come back to this one...it's the best...easy to fill, easy to drink from and bomb proof....
customer_reviews.author: Haley

customer_reviews.title: Tough enough for a through hike
customer_reviews.text: I used this on the PCT while through hiking and it stood up to the rough trail.
customer_reviews.author: Kirsten

customer_reviews.title: Better material than my original from 8 years ago.
customer_reviews.text: I needed a replacement bladder and this one is better than their original form 8 years ago. better build quality and quick detach tube.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Much better than my original reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a replacement reservoir. I like that it has an open/close switch along with the bite cap cause it keeps the cap from leaking. I also like that the tube is reinforced with some material as my last reservoir began cracking and leaking all over the place. Tight water fill cap as well.
customer_reviews.author: MCDC

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy and easy to use but hard to clean
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for hiking but such a pain to try to clean and dry. I use vinegar so it doesn’t get detergent buildup or mildew and dry it in front of a fan.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Hatcher

customer_reviews.title: Gotta love a Camelbak
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Lifetime warranty Great build quality Amazing Customer support Great product! Cons: Difficult to fully clean out without a specific set of tools.
customer_reviews.author: M S Mc Cright

customer_reviews.title: Does not fit standard water filter for backpackers
customer_reviews.text: The opening is far too large to use on standard water filters. Returned product. Otherwise it is a nice bladder.
customer_reviews.author: poc

customer_reviews.title: The twist cap is VERY hard to unscrew :(
customer_reviews.text: It does not make the water taste like rubber. The bite valve system works well (though it did develop a pinhole leak after 2-3yrs of use, which I think is acceptable). Worst part about this thing is the cap. It is VERY hard to unscrew. It turns my fingers into hotdogs, just trying to twist it open. I can't imagine how people with carpel tunnel or arthritis would use this. But it seems pretty much all of these reservoirs have twist caps like this, no matter the brand and model
customer_reviews.author: Ali Ahern

customer_reviews.title: This Is The One To Buy
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love? Sturdy, capacious, easy to fill and easy to clean. I now use this in my Bergen and it's proved its worth through multiple hard training days in serious heat. Best of all is to use DripDrop hydration powder (I prefer the lemon flavor) so that you get all the electrolytes you need as you sweat through another hard tab.
customer_reviews.author: Allan M. Lees

customer_reviews.title: dependable, tough.
customer_reviews.text: can carry enough water to last a whole day ride.
customer_reviews.author: ted k

customer_reviews.title: A great upgrade to a decade old one that developed a leak
customer_reviews.text: you can't lose the cap, or over tighten, still a bit of pain to clean out, but by and large, good
customer_reviews.author: Eric C. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: Awesome reservoir. This is a great replacement for the ...
customer_reviews.text: Awesome reservoir. This is a great replacement for the cheapo that came with my old camelback. This thing has held up to a bunch of mtn bike falls in woods on rocks, etc. I love the quick disconnects, again, no water leaked after falls. Cleaning is a breeze after use with hot hot water and let air dry completely taken apart. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Groff

customer_reviews.title: Somethings in life are worth buying brand name
customer_reviews.text: I tried cheaper hydration systems only to make a big mess when filling the bladder. Nothing compares to the build of these bladders. The big mouth and fat threads make refilling a breeze without spilling all over the place The neoprene sleeve is helpful in sub zero temperatures to avoid an ice-block in your tube. If you've bought a cheap hydration pack, do yourself a favor and replace your bladder with this.
customer_reviews.author: Sterling

customer_reviews.title: (motorcycle) It works great. i bought a little lightweight bag that is ...
customer_reviews.text: i bought this to have on long bike rides. (motorcycle) It works great. i bought a little lightweight bag that is made to hold a bladder and when ever i ride further than around town i take it with me so that i do not have to pull over to get a little drink.
customer_reviews.author: John L.

customer_reviews.title: Works like the old reservoir
customer_reviews.text: Didn't leak because it doesn't have the 1/4 turn lock lid as the new model.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony

customer_reviews.title: I ordered another mouthpiece because I like it overall but was disappointed in the very short ...
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this product because of the CamelBak name and I have had them before. This one boasts a "military" level quality. However, I took this hunting and the mouthpiece has a rigid (almost sharp) inner core that caused the rubber mouthpiece to tear and thus not work well. I ordered another mouthpiece because I like it overall but was disappointed in the very short time it took to tear.
customer_reviews.author: brad

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Fit perfectly in my Osprey Kyte 46. No leaking. Easy to use. Took it on an overnight camping trip with no issues.
customer_reviews.author: L. Pollard

customer_reviews.title: Great Bladder
customer_reviews.text: I love Camelbak bladders. Easy to clean and fill. Bite valve comfortable and easy to use. I like the on/off switch to prevent leaking. I invested in bite covers which I would recommend also to keep dirt and grime off valve. I had a lid to a past Camelbak break and customer service was great and sent me a replacement quickly and free of charge. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amaya Hilliard

customer_reviews.title: Sweet product.
customer_reviews.text: Its a CamelBak what more can I say! Its fit and finish is superb, the QR hose connections are awesome! The bite valve is great with a smooth on off function. Only gripe is the QR on the bite valve makes it a bit hard to get under a mask (air soft/paintball) Quick lock lid is great and it holds 3L of water!
customer_reviews.author: Panchira!

customer_reviews.title: works well
customer_reviews.text: Like most products of this nature, the drinking tube had a bit of a garden hose plastic taste that reminded me of my childhood, but that's not really a problem. After filling the reservoir a few times, I let it sit for a spell, and not a drop of water leaked out. the nozzles all work well, and everything stays dry on the outside. It's the quality product I've come to expect from camelbak.
customer_reviews.author: BROX

customer_reviews.title: GREAT BLADDER FOR MY CAMELBACK
customer_reviews.text: THIS ONE HAS A REMOVABLE TIP FOR EASIER CLEANING AND THE HOSE IS COVERED WITH NEOPRENE TO KEEP COOLER IN THE TUBE.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan Womboldt

customer_reviews.title: Love my camelback during hunting season especially archery elk with ...
customer_reviews.text: Love my camelback during hunting season especially archery elk with the amount of hiking we do. Big opening I start off with frozen 16oz water bottle in it and fill with water. As day goes on I pour remaining into bladder to have cold water at least half day cause your body against pack will warm it up.
customer_reviews.author: Darus

customer_reviews.title: This one worked like a charm
customer_reviews.text: Because I'm always getting back from the field and forgetting to clean out my water bladder, ordering a new one of these was necessary. This one worked like a charm, had a great fit with my CamebBak, and came in good condition.
customer_reviews.author: Melmarie92

customer_reviews.title: I really like this a lot
customer_reviews.text: I really like this a lot, only problem is the new smell hasn't gone away, and I can taste it. Also the tube is a little long and I have to pull it back in to make it a little shorter, but that's really not a problem. In time, the smell will go away, and I'll figure out my perfect length and end up modifying my bag someway to make the tube not hang down so low.
customer_reviews.author: J

product_meta.title: CamelBak 90352 Omega Water Reservoir, 100 oz., Black
product_meta.description: Camelbak 100 oz/3.0L mg OMEGA reservoir 90352. Camping backpacks hydration packs replacement parts. Made of the highest quality materials.
